      • correctColor

        public static java.awt.Color correctColor(int r,
                          int g,
                          int b)
        Creates a new color based on the specified component values. If the values are out of the appropriate color bounds, they are adjusted to fit in. (-10 becomes 0, 260 becomes 255, etc.)
        Parameters:
        r - the red value
        g - the green value
        b - the blue value
        Returns:
        a new Color

      • quadrant

        public static int quadrant(double angle)
        Calculates what quadrant an angle (in radians) is in. Uses the following conventions:
      • [0, pi/2) - quadrant I
      • [pi/2, pi) - quadrant II
      • [pi, 3pi/2) - quadrant III
      • [3pi/2, 2pi) - quadrant IV

        For angles outside of [0, 2pi), equivalent coterminal angles are used.

Parameters:
angle - an angle, in radians
Returns:
the quadrant of angle

  • getAcceleration

    public static double getAcceleration(Point2d location,
                     Point2d sourceLocation,
                     double strength,
                     double g)
    Returns the gravitational acceleration experienced by an object.
    Parameters:
    location - the location of the object experiencing the acceleration
    sourceLocation - the location of where the source of gravity comes from
    strength - the strength (typically the mass) of the source
    g - the gravitational constant
    Returns:
    the magnitude of the acceleration felt

  • getAngle

    public static double getAngle(double xDif,
              double yDif)
    Calculates the angle (in radians), formed by (0,0) and (xDif, yDif).
    Parameters:
    xDif - the x value
    yDif - the y value
    Returns:
    the angle, in the range [0, 2pi)

  • getAngle

    public static double getAngle(Point2d p1,
              Point2d p2)
    Calculates the angle formed between two points. The angle is measured from the first point to the second, against the horizontal line on which the first point sits, measured from the right and counter-clockwise.
    Parameters:
    p1 - the first point
    p2 - the second point
    Returns:
    the angle, in the the range [0, 2pi)

  • getShiftedColor

    public static java.awt.Color getShiftedColor(java.awt.Color color,
                             int maxDifference)
    Returns a new Color with each component randomly shifted by at most d. The values are adjusted so that the new Color is valid.
    Parameters:
    color - the base color
    maxDifference - the maximum change for any one color
    Returns:
    a color randomly shifted by at most maxDifference

    Parameters:

    b - the maximum value (exclusive)
    Returns:
